headline: 'The Five' preview Trump's first State of the Union address
subHeadline: President Trump's speech to focus on economy, infrastructure, immigration, trade and national security; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Live from Washington, D.C. Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in our nation's capital, and this is "The Five." It's four hours away from the big annual show on Capitol Hill, the State of the Union address live at 9 p.m. Eastern. The bells are ringing. It's amazing. Greg Gutfeld is singing. It will be President Trump first, though he did addressed a joint session of congress last February soon after his inauguration. We're expecting to get excerpts soon. We'll bring those to you when they come in. The White House says the tone of the speech will be bright and optimistic. The president will speak bipartisanship on a number of issues, jobs and the economy, infrastructure, immigration, trade and national security. It's been a contentious year between Republicans and Democrats. Will there be more compromise ahead, more unity and less divisiveness? Let's go to the one who is so optimistic, bright and sunny. utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: .... to justify the spying, that's problematic.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: If there was evidence that a Trump official is...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But what if they didn't?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: ... involved in collusion, you say, "Oh, don't pay any attention"?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If I see collusion, I'll say collusion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I've not seen this with the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. That's in your dreams.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan, I have a question for you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do I look like -- do I look like the boy from "The Christmas Story"?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Huggable. Very huggable at the moment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I like that jacket.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How many layers do you have on?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Seventeen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Calm down, calm down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm like an onion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. All right, young people. Calm down. Lots of Democrats won't be at tonight's speech. They're boycotting. Maxine Waters, congresswoman from California, plans to give her own national address later. The protest drama heating up in cold D.C. Next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Freezing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That looks cool.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Back to what's important today, bringing the country together. That's what the State of the Union is all about. Unity. But that can't happen if you don't show up. At least 12 Democrat lawmakers say they're boycotting. One of them Congresswoman Maxine Waters, who's an outspoken critic of President Trump, will deliver her own rebuttal on BET. Meanwhile, another leftie lawmaker explains why he is going to be a no-show.

utterances.speaker: REP. EARL BLUMENAUR (D), OREGON
utterances.sentences: I respect deeply the office of president, but over the course of the last year, Donald Trump has demonstrated that he doesn't respect the office. He's lied repeatedly to the American people. He's sowed discord. He's failed to take advantage of opportunities to bring us together. I don't think there's anything to be gained by my dignifying a performance of a reality TV star. What he reads off a teleprompter tells you nothing about what is in this man's head and in his heart.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, Greg, what do you make of the no-shows?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I wasn't listening to that man in the bowtie. I'll be honest with you. I looked at him and I said, "Don't need to hear him either." That's my point. See? I chose to boycott him. See how that doesn't work? If you remove conversation from this, all you have left is conflict and anger and possibly violence. You know, we evolved as animals to have communication in order to move away from our impulses. If you go from impulse without debate, you have violence. So I think you should talk more and hit people less. That's my perception for a good life. I'm freezing right now.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I know. I can tell. And you put on your little gloves and...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I had to start sitting on my hands.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. Good place for them. All right, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Boycotters, OK. I -- I worked for a congressman years ago when I first started on the Hill. He was a Republican from Colorado, and he never went to the State of the Union address. But he never told anybody he didn't go to the State of the Union address. He just went home and watched it on TV.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I would do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So that was like, if you don't want to go, like, there's a way to do that without making, you know, a spectacle of it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, Jesse, what do you make of the people that are boycotting it? Is it empty symbolism or effective boycotting?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think it's symbolism, but I think it's selfish. Dana, I totally agree with Dana. These people are just drawing attention to themselves. They're not even drawing attention to the issues, because no one thinks about the issues that they're trying to fight for. Everyone is just seeing these people, if it's a bow tie, glasses, a crazy hat, usually the most flamboyant left-wing people are the boycotters. And that may play well with their base, but that doesn't play well with most of the American people. If you poll it, most Americans want this country to come together and take action, and that's what you're going to see tonight with the president. He's trying to bring everybody together and do bold things for the American people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you think they'd like my jacket?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know those flamboyant Supreme Court justices that won't be there. Oh, so self-serving, so self-aggrandizing. Let me just tell you: Who is the one that has destroyed unity in the country? Oh, gee. Oh, yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think they're not there, because President Obama tried to show them up to their face on the last State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: President Obama?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You remember that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You go so far back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He called out the...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So far back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: ... in the State of the Union address? You don't remember that?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I have a memory, Juan. I know you don't, but I do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I was just going to say, Donald Trump, all you've got to remember is the last -- or first year of Donald Trump and how divisive he has been. So the idea that people would exercise...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: President Obama wasn't divisive, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Not like this guy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, never. Not divisive at all.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This guy has the lowest approval ratings in history.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ratings only matter on election day, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, I see. Well, anyway, for this moment, I don't see how you can say that the people who are saying, "This is not a good president, and I am objecting and making it clear by not showing up," that they're to blame. That's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. Well, I mean, what are they really going to accomplish by not showing up?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They get good press back home, and that's probably what they care about the most.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So maybe it is. It's just self-serving. Is it really in the best interests of the country, Greg, if they're going to sit it out and take a knee?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I just want to remind you you're getting paid to be here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I am. I am.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: There's a minute thirty left.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And this break, and then we've got to do a whole other whole segment about this. This messy SOTU, as they call it. That stands for State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: State of the Union. Our final thoughts are going to be awesome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So painful.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I can tell. Greg is like really -- why don't you sit on one of those little hand warmers?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I do. I have one, and it's not working. My butt is cold, like my heart.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God. Oh, my God. Jesse, what do you think in terms of communications from the White House to address any of the people that are boycotting that don't want to be there, you know, in face of the president's message of unification?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I would ignore it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't comment on it at all. If I was asked about it, I would deflect and not give them any attention.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Agree.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Just own your moment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I can't believe Dana actually agreed with something I said. That felt really good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think your mother is going to be very, very pleased.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm doing well down here in D.C.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right, fantastic. OK, final thoughts and our final moments here on "The Five." And Greg can man up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Aww.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Back now here in our nation's capital with some final thoughts ahead of President Trump's first State of the Union address. Kimberly, I'll start with you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think it's a tremendous opportunity tonight that presents itself to the president of the United States, a message of unification, of a strong and proud and safe America, themes that should resonate well with the men and women across this country. I think we've had tremendous inroads in terms of national security and foreign policy, especially with the accomplishments that he has made in terms of restoring the rules of engagement, ISIS, all of the above. I think really strong messaging there. Also with the economy and the job numbers, that's something he can be very proud of. And people are going to feel it in their wallet. Tax reform getting done. He can really build the momentum for some of the other legislative efforts that he would like to accomplish during his presidency.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So I think it's like "Real Housewives of D.C." Because all the talk around the town today was, oh, Mrs. Trump is going to be there, because people feel like she's been missing for the last several days. So that's good news. And I think it's just gossipy. It's just a lot of what we have come to in the Trump era. People just like, yes, as Greg said, it's a State of the Union, but it's all the sideshow. It's the reality TV that you can't take your eyes off of.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes, I don't know who's gossiping about that, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'll tell you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I really don't know. I've been thinking a lot about Greg's outfit tonight, and I think we came up with, he looks like the guy from "A Christmas Story." Grover Dill was, I think, his name. I think -- do we have a picture? Can we do, like, a side -- there we go!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just missing the hat.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: If only we had the hat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Look at that. That should get you an invite to the State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: GRAY NEWSBOY HAT SUPERIMPOSED ON GREG'S HEAD

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Look at your hat on your little head.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He wishes he had that hat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So cute.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Is that your final thought?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, I would agree with Kimberly on prosperity and safety. He's got a great record to run on and just looking forward to the future. Trying to bring the country together, and I think there are some things the Democrats can get on board on. Whether they will, we will see.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I would say that the economy being so much better and the headlines all across the country being so good gives the president, obviously, a lot to talk about tonight; and a little victory lap is in order. But it also is a time when the country can then start to think about OK, in this period when we have a good economy, what do we need to do to set us up for the future, for success? Whether that be worker retraining, the infrastructure, whatever it is. I'm going to be looking for those types of things tonight -- Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think it should be like me, short and sweet.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And he should just move on and say, "See you later. This is the last one you're ever going to see, but I'll be talking all week. You just follow me on Twitter." Having said that, in approximately seven or eight minutes, I will be drinking. I will be drinking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Alone.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: To work off this chill.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And complaining less?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, complaining less and drinking more. That's my -- basically, my advice for everything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Alcohol is going to make you colder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's not. Not this kind of alcohol. Trust me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, you've got one minute left in this show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's sing a song, a campfire song.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are we going to work on releasing the secret show?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think we should. I think we should. A lot of dirty stuff in there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We talked about in the commercial break, and we are going to take a vote on whether "The Five" should release the secret show we taped a while ago that had to get thrown in the trash.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A lot of -- there was a lot of ugliness that went on in there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think the Republicans want it out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We're going to release...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Release it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are you with us, Juan?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is you had a Democrat, you'd probably leak it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Remember, the Democrats, being obstructionist, having learned from the Republicans, may try to block it. But there's no -- it's futile. There's no keeping that show secret.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan is going to leak the secret show to CNN.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Of course he will.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Get the real show out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It will just help build up ratings.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what? It's going to Greg's pal, Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't smear Lou.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, it's been fun, and it's been real cold. OK. That's it for us. We'll see you tomorrow with our break down of tonight's address. Keep it right here on "The Five" -- FOX News Channel for continuing news coverage. Over now to our friend, Bret Baier.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Bret Brrr.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yay, Greg.

utterances.speaker: BRET BAIER, FOX NEWS ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Dana. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc. All materials herein are protected by United States copyright law and may not be reproduced, distributed, transmitted, displayed, published or broadcast without the prior written permission of CQ-Roll Call. You may not alter or remove any trademark, copyright or other notice from copies of the content.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Live from Washington, D.C. Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in our nation's capital, and this is "The Five." It's four hours away from the big annual show on Capitol Hill, the State of the Union address live at 9 p.m. Eastern. The bells are ringing. It's amazing. Greg Gutfeld is singing. It will be President Trump first, though he did addressed a joint session of congress last February soon after his inauguration. We're expecting to get excerpts soon. We'll bring those to you when they come in. The White House says the tone of the speech will be bright and optimistic. The president will speak bipartisanship on a number of issues, jobs and the economy, infrastructure, immigration, trade and national security. It's been a contentious year between Republicans and Democrats. Will there be more compromise ahead, more unity and less divisiveness? Let's go to the one who is so optimistic, bright and sunny. Greg, what do you say?

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Two observations. I think he's going to do a great job because the expectations are set so low by the media. They are so upset with him, and they expect so little from him that all he will have to do is just be.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think expectations are high for him this time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I don't think so at all. I think that people -- people are looking forward to him being evil and wrong and he'll be nice. But my other thing is someone will take a page out of Eddie Ferguson from The Weekly Standard, and Kevin Williams from National View. It would be much better if he got out there and he said, you know what, you don't need this. I tweet every day. You don't need the State of the Union. All you've got to do is follow me on twitter. I tell you everything that's on my mind. This is the first and last State of the Union I'm ever going to do. Take your family out to dinner on those bonuses. I'm going home. That would be the most awesome State of the Union of all time.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He might get a standing ovation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He would. He would. But that's the problem with this stuff it's so fake. The reason why the State of the Union sucks is that it's so fake. People standing up, people sitting down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's so choreographed, manufactured. It makes me sad inside, like a lot of things.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, one thing -- when I look at those snapshot is I am like one of the shortest people ever on the planet.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: You've just realizing that right now?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They gave me a choice between a pillow or a heated seats. And I went with the heated seat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I'm going to steal that heated seat in a moment. I'm a little.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're on the hot seat.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, what do you think? Are you excited for tonight like Greg is?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I am excited. I don't want him to tweet it because I want to watch Ruth Bader Ginsburg fall asleep.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She's not going to be there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's not going to be there? Oh, darn it. OK. Well, someone is going to fall asleep and someone will embarrass themselves. At one point the camera will go to a very old senator and that senator will be dozing off and those of the best moments. Also interesting to see who people bring, it turns outs the Democrats are bringing illegal aliens. A lot of people are saying they should bring ICE agents to just round them up right there. Other people are bringing transgender military members. And I'm hearing the congressional black caucus might do a black power fist and walk out. So, you know, all of these may be noble causes, but I really don't think the Democrats are connecting with mainstream Americans. The president is going to be on teleprompter, and a lot of people who support President Trump love teleprompter Trump. They used to make fun of Barack Obama when he was on the teleprompter, but we love President Trump when he's on the teleprompter because he fixed the script. It's going to be a lot of recounting all of the winning, which could take a very long time, Juan, especially with all the applause. And then he's going to be looking forward to the next year and try to bring unity and find some items like infrastructure, immigration and trade that the Democrats might be able to get on board with.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Buy that, Juan?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Oh, you know, I'm just overwhelmed by the winning. It's just been so much winning. So when I look at the numbers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Trump said you would be sick of it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I know because it's just so overwhelming. I am thrilled, Jesse. I am thrilled because I understand as his guest he'll have like stormy Daniels, may be, or how about Steve Wynn.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Maybe he should bring Lewinsky.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It was a $130,000 shot, I think. So, I think what you've got here, Dana, is a guy who is going to try to stay on prompter to pick up on what Jesse was talking about. And I think from what we hear, Gary Cohn, who did so well for the president in Davos is really in charge of this speech along with Stephen Miller. Now, Stephen miller is kind of a fire and brimstone guy, and I think they're going to try to bring a little bit of that. You look at the guest list and you're going to have people there whose children were killed by MS-13. I think they're going to go back hard on the immigration side of it, and that's going to come from Miller. But I think from Cohn, you'll hear a lot of talk about the benefits of economics and the tax cut and the hope that -- while he talked about America first, he's not saying -- I'm just repeating a line that he said at Davos. It's not America alone. And so, in that sense, it really does speak to something I hope he does, which is reach out to the American people and say that there is a possibility. But my fear is that's not Donald Trump. And so, I just -- you know, I can dream about it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Even a year ago in February when he did the joint session speech, Kimberly, it was a teleprompter speech. Remember that is where many commentators from both the left and the right said now, that's a presidential speech.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely, I think President Trump is going to exceed expectations tonight. He has a lot of material to work with in terms of the accomplishments, with the economy, infrastructure, tax reform, immigration, all of the above. So I think there's a lot of checkpoints that he can make in terms of saying, hey, this is what I promised the American people, the working class men and women across this country that felt forgotten. I'm honoring my promises that I made during the campaign, fulfilling them during my presidency. And the whole theme of a safe and strong America is one that resonates. There can't be anybody who's against a safe and strong, prosperous country. And that's what he's going to hit tonight.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: One of the things on economy, a good economy allows you to do, Greg, is to have some space to think about other things that you want to work on. So, if jobs are back and the American people feel like the economy is better and they have confidence and you can deal with other things. So, he's expected to talk tonight about infrastructure and opiate addiction in addition to immigration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't want him to talk about anything. I have to reiterate this that I don't want to hear what he can make government do more of. You should just do a little punch list. Here's the jobs numbers. Here's the economy. Here's how many ISIS fighters we've killed. OK. That's what happened this year. I'm going to try and do some other things this year. Another little punch list, like three little things, and then just be done with it. This is for the rest of America, not for the left of America. He shouldn't care about impressing people that want more government. He should just do it. You know what he is. The reason why he's so different and the reason why everybody has problems with him is that he's running a country like it's a business. He's like a boss and you can't shake it. So, he should just treat it like a meeting -- like he comes in and goes OK, so we did this. We did this. We did this. That's all right. We've got to do this. And if we don't do this, you're in trouble. I'm firing this guy. That's how he talks. He should just do that because the way it used to go before, let's face it, didn't matter who's doing the State of the Union, it was pompous and choreographed and we pretended to be interested. Let's just let it go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you're definitely going to watch?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I have to. But you know what it is? It's like the great thing about Trump is he -- look at the correspondents' dinner. All these traditional things implode under his watch. Why can't this one?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think this is going to be the last State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But the president does receive better numbers when he does these big, historic events. You get the pomp and circumstance, the majesty of it all. Trump does very well. The Democrats on the other hand have I think six different responses to the State of the Union, so they're totally fractured. And who knows what they're going to say. Bernie is doing his thing. I believe Kamala Harris is doing her thing. Who knows what the Democratic Party stands for anymore. So, I think Trump will receive a big bump after tonight.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There was a headline today, Juan, that said Democrats, especially in red states, are starting to panic because of all the good economic news.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't think that's rational. One of the interesting things about Trump's poor poll numbers is that if you ask the American people about the economy, they say the economy is good, economic confidence, consumer confidence up. But they don't necessarily connect that to Donald Trump. They give lots of credit -- I think more credit to Barack Obama.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not true,

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And obviously, most presidents, while they're in office, they take credit for anything because they also get blamed for everything. But here's a situation where the American people say it's clearly, the recovery was ongoing. Trump comes in. I think, by the way, in response to Greg's terrible attitude about our wonderful State of the Union address, you get - - you're going to have some reality TV. And you have got Mr. Reality TV delivering the speech.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait. So I think you're going to have people who don't show up. I think lots of members of the Hispanic caucus, the black caucus who say, hey, why should I show up and listen to a guy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, you're going to get arrested.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're coming for you, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, because we've called Trump out on a lie. You can't do that. You can't do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I do think, Kimberly, one of the things -- one of the reasons that Greg and others feel that way about the State of the Union is because it was never supposed to be that way. The State of the Union is supposed to be just a letter, really, or just a notification that everything is fine. Don't worry about stuff. But it has grown so much. But the visualization of who you bring, it's almost become more important than the actual words of the speech. And tonight, both sides are going to have very compelling and interesting members of the American public there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah. It's also a visual presentation in terms of who you will get for your side, sort of be symbolic in terms of your party, your movement, the type of things that you want to accomplish. And also, maybe, some of the points that you want to make that you need to improve upon. So, OK, I have the support from this community or that community. But I do think that President Trump, besides having a visual presentation of who shows up for him, it's also really going to be strong in terms of the rhetoric and mirroring some of the themes that he laid out in Davos as well, because he does have quite a bit to work with. And for President Trump, I don't think he's going to miss the opportunity to capture the moment for the American people because there's a lot more that he wants to accomplish, and this is the way and the vehicle by which that he can really garner that support moving forward for some of the legislative policies and things that he like to accomplish.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse, last word?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And for all the Democrats that say this guy is the worst president of all time, they're going to be jumping over themselves to try to shake his hand as he walks down the aisle to get a nice photo opportunity so they can send it back.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Did you miss the idea that people aren't showing up to protest.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So Trump is not going to shake any Democratic hands? Do you want to take a bet, Juan? You want to make a bet?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm saying the news is -- it's like -- you know, they say it's not news about the jets that landed at national airport. It's news about the jets that crash.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No one cares who is not showing up.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's not only not showing up, it's their protests in the streets.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We have a whole 50 minutes left to talk about this. Coming up, celebrities and activists gather for an anti-Trump People's State of the Union. Greg breaks down why the left resistance event flops when The Five returns from Washington.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Last night was the People's State of the Union. It's the left-wing tofu to tonight's State of the Union. Do you want a taste? Have a bucket nearby.

utterances.speaker: FISHER STEVENS, ACTOR
utterances.utterance: This man name Zinke, who claims to be Teddy, got rid of climate science programs already. He actually rides his horse to work like a (BLEEP).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's Fisher Stevens -- I thought he was dead, but he's still alive and, apparently, a celebrity.

utterances.speaker: Afterwards, news outlets focused on one thing only
utterances.utterance: star power. Not the principles. Star power. Because without that the event was just a rehash of anti-West, hard-left diatribes. American-caused genocide? Check. Evil white male privilege? Check. Real winners there.

utterances.speaker: But what caught the press was not the radicalism but that it was star-studded. True, there was Mark Ruffalo and Kathy Najimy. If that's star-studded, so is any rest stop on Sunset Boulevard. I should know. What the press ignored
utterances.utterance: The same divisive politics that spooks most Americans. Blaming others for your problems is so last decade, and yet they can't stop. But what's also weird, this event was last night before the actual speech, which tells you everything. They only want to hear themselves. But the curse of refusing to hear those you disagree with, you remove the one step that unites people, which is conversation, which leads only then to conflict without it, but maybe that's what they want. The People's State of the Union may not be about people at all but division and emotional actors who celebrity provides cover for their unpopular radical beliefs. And they need the cover because no one wants leftism. It hurts too many lives. Look at history. So last night may have felt like a great movie for the media, but it's one movie that America will happily skip. You know, Jesse, what drove me nuts about this, and I say driving me nuts loosely because I really don't care.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Because you're nuts already.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm nuts already. Everything was about how star-studded it was. They totally left out the fact that what they were talking about was so purely anti-American drivel that you've heard for 40, 50 years, but that's just -- you know, a gossip columnist for people, they can't handle that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Here's how I knew it wasn't star-studded. When Juan, yesterday, asked who was going to be at the event and we said Mark Ruffalo, and he said who's that? And then he said what movies he be in, and we all started googling Mark Ruffalo. These guys aren't A-listers. And they try -- all they care about is who they are, not what they say because if you put them on a panel up here like this, they can't debate the issues.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There's no substance to the argument. It's all anger. And something Mark Ruffalo said that really kind of bother me, he accused President Trump of being lazy. Ruffalo wakes up and does 10:00 AM yoga on a beach in Malibu, and then goes gets his fingernails waxed. This guy is not a hard worker. Being an actor in Hollywood is the easiest job in the world. Don't tell someone else you don't have a good workout.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What is fingernail waxing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have no idea but he does that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think he means fingernail buffing, but he also lives in New York.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan, Michael Moore used the phrase cleanse when he was talking about white males, like we need to cleanse white male privilege. Do you think that's going to go over well with Middle America? Yeah, let's cleanse America of white male privilege, which basically says like get rid of white males.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, it's not. It's about privilege. But, by the way, I mean, you could talk about low wattage celebrities, I mean, you know, this essentially is a left-wing version of the tea party back in 2010.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tea party was actually Americans.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Every day Americans. Tell me what celebrity caution of the tea party?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's what I've said, they didn't have any.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The tea party was an actual organic, real movement by Americans.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This is not real? Let me tell you, this is so real they have town hall in the middle of Manhattan packed last night.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: little of Manhattan. How did celebrity work out for Hillary, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me just say they have hundreds of thousands of people watching, streaming, including Greg Gutfeld. Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Greg, it was also sort of your assignment to get a monologue on it. So on Greg's behalf, he sort of had to.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me drop the bomb for you guys, de Blasio was in. Go ahead, guys, blow up, blow up. I know you don't like de Blasio.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But it's not at all surprising that de Blasio was there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, do you care that de Blasio was there? I like to call Lurch.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean, if big bird was there that's definitely not an event you wanted to be. What can I tell you? I mean, look, I don't care if they have B or C-list, I would rather have the real people like you had in the tea party movement than like celebrities without scripts. Not a good idea. Trying to come forward to proffer some enthusiasm and a sense of honor and integrity to try to criticize what's happening in this country. I don't think it worked. It didn't do anything for me. It didn't move me. Didn't move my dial.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They used Clooney and Diddy, and now they have de Blasio. I think that says it all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, I mean, I will say this, Dana, I watched it and I saw - - Ruffalo really believes it. And he has the energy -- I could see him possibly running because he's not really a big star.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He's very into the environments.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, he was bragging about -- not bragging, but talking about the whole pipeline protests. How that end up?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right, getting approved.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Thank you, Mark.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So the Democrats are in a real pickle.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, watch your mouth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They have this division and it's hard -- how do you figure it out. If you're Chuck Schumer and you're trying to figure it out, their goal in 2018 is to try to take back the senate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: . and the house, but the senate in particular. And he's got red state Democrats that are having to run for reelection in ten states where President Trump won some of those states by double digits. And yet he has a base that is pulling them so far to the left, and they are energized. Young people are energized by this type of Hollywood thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And they don't read history. They don't know about communism and socialism and how many millions have died by these.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do you want to challenge them to a debate?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The celebrities versus The Five.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, Family Feud.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Mark Ruffalo, Fisher Stevens and his crazy beard. Who else was there? Kathy Najimy -- I think that was.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Only if he brings a harmonica.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, you forgot my favorite, Cynthia Nixon. And she made a great point, which is that a year ago when Trump gave his speech, guess what, Russian was hanging over Trump's head. And tonight, as he gives his speech, Russia is still hanging over Trump's head.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's interesting. None of those liberals in the 70's or 60's, Russia wasn't never hanging over their heads. They were fellow travelers with the communist.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. Russia didn't help them get elected.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But didn't Cynthia Nixon say she might run?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. She better not run until she does the Sex and the City sequel because that's more important.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sex and the sequel?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sex and the sequel. That's very strange.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Just be yourself, Greg, honestly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Ahead, President Trump's speech tonight. Lawmakers on the hill are divided over secret Russia memo. Who wrote this? That's next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: House intelligence committee has voted to release a classified memo the Republican say the American people need to see. It allegedly reveals government surveillance abuses in the Russian investigation. President Trump has five days to decide whether he has any objections to the document before it can be made public. The committee's top Democrat slammed the decision.

utterances.speaker: REP. ADAM SCHIFF, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: A very sad day I think in the history of this committee. Sadly, we can fully expect that the president of the United States will not put the national interest over his own personal interests, but it is a sad day indeed when that is also true of our own committee because today this committee voted to put the president's personal interests, perhaps their own political interests, above the national interest.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer, take a step further accusing the GOP of ganging up on the FBI. Meanwhile, House Speaker Paul Ryan backs the memo's release.

utterances.speaker: HOUSE SPEAKER PAUL RYAN, R-WIS.
utterances.utterance: There may have been malfeasance at the FBI by certain individuals, so it is our job in conducting transparent oversight of the executive branch to get to the bottom of that. Sunshine is the best disinfectant. And so, what we want is all of this information to come out so that transparency can reign supreme and accountability can occur.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. So transparency, Juan, if there are abuses in the DOJ and FBI, what's wrong with finding out what they are?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I have no problem with finding out what they are, but this is written by Devin Nunes, head of house intel, who has been a total stooge, lackey for President Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But it's based on facts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's based on cherry picked facts, Jesse. So, in other word.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Based on actual raw intelligence.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How do you know?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because if it was raw intelligence, then it would be classified and you couldn't see it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Listen, let me just tell you something. This is a set up. And, you know, you talk about transparency, and I'm all for government transparency, but this is not. This is about muddying the Waters, degrading the FBI, going after Justice. I think this is a lead up to potentially Trump going after Rod Rosenstein.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, if there are dirty cops, you want to know it on the street, and you want to know it in the federal government, I think. What do you think about this? You just don't like the word "memo." You're sick of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I've never seen an earth-shattering memo in my life. I'm very suspect. And this is because I love our viewers. Do not let yourself get let down by all the liberals, like they have over Russian collusion. Every day, they have the boom, tick-tock, it's happening, and it never happens. You know, when I see the phrase like "earth-shattering" or "jaw-dropping," it reminds me of those late-night Cinemax movies that promise so much; and then you watch two hours and you're like, "Why did I watch this?" Nothing happened, and nobody is even that good-looking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: TMI, Gutfeld. What do you say, Dana, about this? Do you really think this could be KGB- style surveillance? Or are you just going to wait until you see the memo?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm going to wait. I'm going to wait. Well, I don't just want to see the memo, actually. I would like to see the underlying evidence, like the raw intelligence. Because...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Will we ever see that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Here's the thing. I do think that the Congress has an oversight responsibility, and they are trying to execute it. I do think they've made a -- made an error. They think that they are able to say this memo has nothing to do with the Bob Mueller investigation. OK? That's what the speaker said today on the floor. That they're trying to say that there's a separation. And yet, I don't see how they've actually effectively made that case, because pretty much everybody who's watching this is like, it's Carter Page. I's connected to the FISA warrant that went to the -- he worked on the Trump campaign, and therefore, Bob Mueller. So I don't think that's been successful. And there's another thing. When we talk about the FISA Act, one of the things that is most important about it is how you have foreign terrorists talking to Americans, and that's how you end up being able to get a wiretap on that person to find out how can you prevent an attack? I don't know what Greg is doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm zipping.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Apparently, the abuses in here are not part of that title in the law. It's something different, in Title I, and I don't think they've done a good job explaining that either. And so to me, it's gotten way too partisan and I think completely ineffective.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's very partisan, because now the Democrats want to release their own memo; and the White House is worried about the Democrats leaking the memo at the wrong time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's so ridiculous. You talk about hypocrisy, wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You do talk a lot about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, because that's Republicans...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Go put your memo out.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The memo is the memo, OK?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Secret show.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You don't even know what's in it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm on the show that never aired because of all that stuff that happened on the show.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you remember the secret show?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What the heck are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The secret show.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: #Releasethesecretshow.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Wait, the one Susan edited?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're going to do it on Friday. We're going to do it on Friday.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The one that Susan edited?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Vote -- everybody has to vote. Does "The Five" release the secret show?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, we send it -- how about we send it to a FISA judge?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. Go to the website and cast your vote.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Got to get going. Got to get going.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The president wants to release it. He just doesn't know when it should be released.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right, OK. Well, in the interest of transparency and trying to have full disclosure, that's what he would like to do. This is one of things that he campaigned on. Of course, we would like to know what's in this, because we want to be able to sort it out. There's a lot of now, perhaps, hyperbole depending on what's in it, what's not, and there is a lot of partisan politics.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So when you see something like this -- but it's interesting, because mostly it's just, like, the Democrat stuff that leaks out, not the Republicans. Why is that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A few hundred Republicans have seen the memo, and it has not leaked yet. It must mean the Democrats are...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And also, I think the media, who -- you know, if they -- if they got their hands on the memo, they would run it. It's not like they're, like, wanting to protect classified information.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, on "Watters' World," we would try to protect national security so we'd hold that back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesse...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We have to -- what I've seen on the missing "Five" show was jaw- dropping. And people are going -- people are going to lose their jobs. I'm not joking. There's a lost show.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, it was -- it was bigger than the American Revolution.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh. All right. Well, stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: People are going to believe this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: CNN and a Holocaust controversy. We'll explain that next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: After stepping down from his post, outgoing FBI Director [SIC] Andrew McCabe has garnered support from the likes of Eric Holder, the former attorney general, and James Comey, the former FBI director. But one person's defense of McCabe, well, may have gone a bit too far. CNN analyst Ana Navarro tweeted the rewording of a Holocaust poem to warn of McCabe's removal. The phrase, quote, "First he came for Comey," end quote, for example, was reworked from an anti-Nazi pastor whose poem criticized Germans for not speaking against Adolf Hitler. Navarro is taking heat for her controversial comparison. Let's take it around. Kimberly, what did you make of this?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I just don't understand sometimes where she's coming from with some of this. I think she just wants to be controversial for the sake of being controversial. I don't really understand sort of what is she getting at? I mean, she says a Trump apologist. She's trying to criticize all the time. I don't know. I'm not -- I'm not someone who actually understands her positioning, because I think it's just inconsistent.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But she's a Republican, right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, this is the point, Juan. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm just saying, it's a Republican, so I don't know. Jesse...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Like a sleeper cell.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: ... we've heard comparisons...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Not a Republican.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We've heard comparisons to Stalin, and there's not explicit in this one but the suggestion -- by the way, the Stalin came from another Republican, Jeff Flake. And now you have suggestions, innuendo, that really, if you don't stand up, you're like people who didn't stand up to Hitler.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's an insult to people who were victims in the Holocaust. But Juan, Ana Navarro is a Republican like you're a Republican.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Me?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Exactly. You're not.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You don't have to worry in that case.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK? So that's a ruse to make CNN look fair and balanced. They book six Democrats, and they put Ana Navarro on, and they think that's squared away. The other thing is here, if Hillary were elected president, she would've fired James Comey. You don't think for a minute Hillary wouldn't have canned Comey the second she took office?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She hated Comey. She hated him. So there's no difference in either of these things. She's ridiculous, and so is CNN.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I -- I think that there must be something there or else you wouldn't have somebody like Paul Ryan say that it's important for this memo to get out, so I think it's better for everybody to just wait. Let the process work, and see what is actually in the document.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think we're all waiting for the document, but when you think about the president's having removed Comey, as having removed McCabe. Sessions under pressure from the president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, but he...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The president didn't remove McCabe.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Christopher Wray removed McCabe. So...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yews.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right, but the idea was that Christopher Wray was under pressure from the president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But he saw -- but he saw the memo on Sunday night and then made that decision Monday morning. So there must be something there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Maybe. All right. So Greg, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love this. I love this. You know, for so -- for so long, the left has questioned all government agencies in terms of national security. Like, I mean, let's not forget, whether it was Snowden or whether it was Assange or the NSA abuses, we were sacrificing freedom for security. It's all they were talking about. God forbid Republicans are questioning the FBI now. And all of a sudden, that's like a sacrilege.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And also, to Navarro, I'm going to let Navarro slide on this. Because maybe she wasn't even aware of what she was doing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh. I think that's...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know, but I'm just going to -- a lot of times people make mistakes. But the bigger question is, you can question the validity of an election, which was the American people, but you can't question an agency that does their stuff behind closed doors. That's strange.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Come on. You're a smart guy. Come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Leave it there. We'll be right there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you think -- do you think this is all about questioning an agency? This is about protecting Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, Juan, when the feds spied on radical Muslims, the left got really upset, but are OK with the feds spying on the Trump campaign?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What spying? What do you mean?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't have it both ways.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Dana just explained to you, you've got to go through a FISA judge. If the information...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If the FISA judge used a fake dossier...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh. What fake dossier? Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: .... to justify the spying, that's problematic.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If there was evidence that a Trump official is...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But what if they didn't?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: ... involved in collusion, you say, "Oh, don't pay any attention"?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If I see collusion, I'll say collusion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I've not seen this with the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes. That's in your dreams.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan, I have a question for you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do I look like -- do I look like the boy from "The Christmas Story"?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Huggable. Very huggable at the moment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I like that jacket.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How many layers do you have on?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Seventeen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Calm down, calm down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm like an onion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. All right, young people. Calm down. Lots of Democrats won't be at tonight's speech. They're boycotting. Maxine Waters, congresswoman from California, plans to give her own national address later. The protest drama heating up in cold D.C. Next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Freezing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That looks cool.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Back to what's important today, bringing the country together. That's what the State of the Union is all about. Unity. But that can't happen if you don't show up. At least 12 Democrat lawmakers say they're boycotting. One of them Congresswoman Maxine Waters, who's an outspoken critic of President Trump, will deliver her own rebuttal on BET. Meanwhile, another leftie lawmaker explains why he is going to be a no-show.

utterances.speaker: REP. EARL BLUMENAUR (D), OREGON
utterances.utterance: I respect deeply the office of president, but over the course of the last year, Donald Trump has demonstrated that he doesn't respect the office. He's lied repeatedly to the American people. He's sowed discord. He's failed to take advantage of opportunities to bring us together. I don't think there's anything to be gained by my dignifying a performance of a reality TV star. What he reads off a teleprompter tells you nothing about what is in this man's head and in his heart.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, Greg, what do you make of the no-shows?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wasn't listening to that man in the bowtie. I'll be honest with you. I looked at him and I said, "Don't need to hear him either." That's my point. See? I chose to boycott him. See how that doesn't work? If you remove conversation from this, all you have left is conflict and anger and possibly violence. You know, we evolved as animals to have communication in order to move away from our impulses. If you go from impulse without debate, you have violence. So I think you should talk more and hit people less. That's my perception for a good life. I'm freezing right now.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I know. I can tell. And you put on your little gloves and...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I had to start sitting on my hands.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. Good place for them. All right, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Boycotters, OK. I -- I worked for a congressman years ago when I first started on the Hill. He was a Republican from Colorado, and he never went to the State of the Union address. But he never told anybody he didn't go to the State of the Union address. He just went home and watched it on TV.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So that was like, if you don't want to go, like, there's a way to do that without making, you know, a spectacle of it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, Jesse, what do you make of the people that are boycotting it? Is it empty symbolism or effective boycotting?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think it's symbolism, but I think it's selfish. Dana, I totally agree with Dana. These people are just drawing attention to themselves. They're not even drawing attention to the issues, because no one thinks about the issues that they're trying to fight for. Everyone is just seeing these people, if it's a bow tie, glasses, a crazy hat, usually the most flamboyant left-wing people are the boycotters. And that may play well with their base, but that doesn't play well with most of the American people. If you poll it, most Americans want this country to come together and take action, and that's what you're going to see tonight with the president. He's trying to bring everybody together and do bold things for the American people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you think they'd like my jacket?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know those flamboyant Supreme Court justices that won't be there. Oh, so self-serving, so self-aggrandizing. Let me just tell you: Who is the one that has destroyed unity in the country? Oh, gee. Oh, yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think they're not there, because President Obama tried to show them up to their face on the last State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: President Obama?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You remember that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You go so far back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He called out the...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So far back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: ... in the State of the Union address? You don't remember that?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have a memory, Juan. I know you don't, but I do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I was just going to say, Donald Trump, all you've got to remember is the last -- or first year of Donald Trump and how divisive he has been. So the idea that people would exercise...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: President Obama wasn't divisive, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Not like this guy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, never. Not divisive at all.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This guy has the lowest approval ratings in history.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Ratings only matter on election day, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, I see. Well, anyway, for this moment, I don't see how you can say that the people who are saying, "This is not a good president, and I am objecting and making it clear by not showing up," that they're to blame. That's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. Well, I mean, what are they really going to accomplish by not showing up?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They get good press back home, and that's probably what they care about the most.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So maybe it is. It's just self-serving. Is it really in the best interests of the country, Greg, if they're going to sit it out and take a knee?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I just want to remind you you're getting paid to be here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I am. I am.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There's a minute thirty left.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And this break, and then we've got to do a whole other whole segment about this. This messy SOTU, as they call it. That stands for State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: State of the Union. Our final thoughts are going to be awesome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So painful.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I can tell. Greg is like really -- why don't you sit on one of those little hand warmers?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do. I have one, and it's not working. My butt is cold, like my heart.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God. Oh, my God. Jesse, what do you think in terms of communications from the White House to address any of the people that are boycotting that don't want to be there, you know, in face of the president's message of unification?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would ignore it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I wouldn't comment on it at all. If I was asked about it, I would deflect and not give them any attention.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Agree.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Just own your moment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I can't believe Dana actually agreed with something I said. That felt really good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think your mother is going to be very, very pleased.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm doing well down here in D.C.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right, fantastic. OK, final thoughts and our final moments here on "The Five." And Greg can man up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Back now here in our nation's capital with some final thoughts ahead of President Trump's first State of the Union address. Kimberly, I'll start with you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think it's a tremendous opportunity tonight that presents itself to the president of the United States, a message of unification, of a strong and proud and safe America, themes that should resonate well with the men and women across this country. I think we've had tremendous inroads in terms of national security and foreign policy, especially with the accomplishments that he has made in terms of restoring the rules of engagement, ISIS, all of the above. I think really strong messaging there. Also with the economy and the job numbers, that's something he can be very proud of. And people are going to feel it in their wallet. Tax reform getting done. He can really build the momentum for some of the other legislative efforts that he would like to accomplish during his presidency.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So I think it's like "Real Housewives of D.C." Because all the talk around the town today was, oh, Mrs. Trump is going to be there, because people feel like she's been missing for the last several days. So that's good news. And I think it's just gossipy. It's just a lot of what we have come to in the Trump era. People just like, yes, as Greg said, it's a State of the Union, but it's all the sideshow. It's the reality TV that you can't take your eyes off of.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, I don't know who's gossiping about that, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I really don't know. I've been thinking a lot about Greg's outfit tonight, and I think we came up with, he looks like the guy from "A Christmas Story." Grover Dill was, I think, his name. I think -- do we have a picture? Can we do, like, a side -- there we go!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just missing the hat.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: If only we had the hat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Look at that. That should get you an invite to the State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.utterance: GRAY NEWSBOY HAT SUPERIMPOSED ON GREG'S HEAD

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Look at your hat on your little head.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He wishes he had that hat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So cute.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is that your final thought?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I would agree with Kimberly on prosperity and safety. He's got a great record to run on and just looking forward to the future. Trying to bring the country together, and I think there are some things the Democrats can get on board on. Whether they will, we will see.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I would say that the economy being so much better and the headlines all across the country being so good gives the president, obviously, a lot to talk about tonight; and a little victory lap is in order. But it also is a time when the country can then start to think about OK, in this period when we have a good economy, what do we need to do to set us up for the future, for success? Whether that be worker retraining, the infrastructure, whatever it is. I'm going to be looking for those types of things tonight -- Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it should be like me, short and sweet.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And he should just move on and say, "See you later. This is the last one you're ever going to see, but I'll be talking all week. You just follow me on Twitter." Having said that, in approximately seven or eight minutes, I will be drinking. I will be drinking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Alone.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: To work off this chill.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And complaining less?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, complaining less and drinking more. That's my -- basically, my advice for everything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Alcohol is going to make you colder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's not. Not this kind of alcohol. Trust me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, you've got one minute left in this show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's sing a song, a campfire song.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Are we going to work on releasing the secret show?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think we should. I think we should. A lot of dirty stuff in there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We talked about in the commercial break, and we are going to take a vote on whether "The Five" should release the secret show we taped a while ago that had to get thrown in the trash.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A lot of -- there was a lot of ugliness that went on in there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think the Republicans want it out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We're going to release...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Release it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Are you with us, Juan?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is you had a Democrat, you'd probably leak it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Remember, the Democrats, being obstructionist, having learned from the Republicans, may try to block it. But there's no -- it's futile. There's no keeping that show secret.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan is going to leak the secret show to CNN.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Of course he will.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Get the real show out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Of course.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It will just help build up ratings.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what? It's going to Greg's pal, Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't smear Lou.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, it's been fun, and it's been real cold. OK. That's it for us. We'll see you tomorrow with our break down of tonight's address. Keep it right here on "The Five" -- FOX News Channel for continuing news coverage. Over now to our friend, Bret Baier.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Bret Brrr.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yay, Greg.

utterances.speaker: BRET BAIER, FOX NEWS ANCHOR
